content.webTitle: US says air tests confirm that blast was nuclear

fields.headline: US says air tests confirm that blast was nuclear
fields.bodyText: Air samples taken last week contained radioactive materials that confirmed that North Korea conducted an underground nuclear test, the office of the US national intelligence director, John Negroponte, said yesterday. In a statement on its website, the office confirmed that the blast was relatively small, at less than one kiloton, equal to 1,000 tonnes of TNT. "Analysis of air samples ... confirms that North Korea conducted an underground nuclear explosion in the vicinity of P'unggye on October 9 2006," the statement said, in America's first official confirmation that the device was nuclear.
